abstract: A Citigroup employee who traded Patrick Corporation stock on the bank’s account lied about his reasons for selling the shares, Australia’s federal court was told Monday. “It is a misleading and dishonest answer you give today,” Bret Walker, a lawyer for the Australian Securities & Investments Commission, told Andrew Manchee, a proprietary trader for Citigroup. “I disagree,” Mr. Manchee replied on the second day of a trial in Sydney.
lead_paragraph: A Citigroup employee who traded Patrick Corporation stock on the bank’s account lied about his reasons for selling the shares, Australia’s federal court was told Monday. “It is a misleading and dishonest answer you give today,” Bret Walker, a lawyer for the Australian Securities & Investments Commission, told Andrew Manchee, a proprietary trader for Citigroup. “I disagree,” Mr. Manchee replied on the second day of a trial in Sydney.

headline.main: Citigroup Trader Accused of Lying in Australian Suit
